briefdescription.para: Status message indicating that Partition function computations are about to begin.
Status message indicating that Partition function computations are finished.
Option flag to specify default settings/requirements.
Option flag to specify requirement of Minimum Free Energy (MFE) DP matrices and corresponding set of energy parameters.
Option flag to specify requirement of Partition Function (PF) DP matrices and corresponding set of Boltzmann factors.
Option flag to specify requirement of dimer DP matrices.
Option flag to specify that neither MFE, nor PF DP matrices are required.

detaileddescription.para: Use this flag in conjuntion with VRNA_OPTION_MFE, and VRNA_OPTION_PF to save memory for a vrna_fold_compound_t obtained from vrna_fold_compound(), or vrna_fold_compound_comparative() in cases where only energy evaluation but no structure prediction is required.

briefdescription.para: Option flag to specify requirement of DP matrices for local folding approaches.

detaileddescription.para: Type is suitable for single, and hybridizing sequences
Type is suitable for sequence alignments (consensus structure prediction)

briefdescription.para: An enumerator that is used to specify the type of a vrna_fold_compound_t.
Typename for the fold_compound data structure vrna_fc_s.
Callback to free memory allocated for auxiliary user-provided data.

detaileddescription.para: This type of user-implemented function usually deletes auxiliary data structures. The user must take care to free all the memory occupied by the data structure passed.

parblock.para: This callback is supposed to free memory occupied by an auxiliary data structure. It will be called when the vrna_fold_compound_t is erased from memory through a call to vrna_fold_compound_free() and will be passed the address of memory previously bound to the vrna_fold_compound_t via vrna_fold_compound_add_auxdata().

parameterdescription.para: The data that needs to be free'd

briefdescription.para: Callback to free memory allocated for auxiliary user-provided data.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* vrna_recursion_status_f) (unsigned char status, void *data)
memberdef.name: vrna_recursion_status_f

briefdescription.para: Callback to perform specific user-defined actions before, or after recursive computations.

parblock.para: This function will be called to notify a third-party implementation about the status of a currently ongoing recursion. The purpose of this callback mechanism is to provide users with a simple way to ensure pre- and post conditions for auxiliary mechanisms attached to our implementations.

simplesect.para: vrna_fold_compound_add_auxdata(), vrna_fold_compound_add_callback(), vrna_mfe(), vrna_pf(), VRNA_STATUS_MFE_PRE, VRNA_STATUS_MFE_POST, VRNA_STATUS_PF_PRE, VRNA_STATUS_PF_POST

parameterdescription.para: The data structure that was assigned with vrna_fold_compound_add_auxdata()

memberdef.definition: typedef void() vrna_callback_recursion_status(unsigned char status, void *data)
memberdef.name: vrna_callback_recursion_status

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *sequence, const vrna_md_t *md_p, unsigned int options)
memberdef.name: vrna_fold_compound

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a vrna_fold_compound_t data structure for single sequences and hybridizing sequences.

detaileddescription.para: This function provides an easy interface to obtain a prefilled vrna_fold_compound_t by passing a single sequence, or two contatenated sequences as input. For the latter, sequences need to be seperated by an '&' character like this:char *sequence = "GGGG&CCCC";

The optional parameter md_p can be used to specify the model details for successive computations based on the content of the generated vrna_fold_compound_t. Passing NULL will instruct the function to use default model details. The third parameter options may be used to specify dynamic programming (DP) matrix requirements.

listitem.para: VRNA_OPTION_DEFAULT - Option flag to specify default settings/requirements.
VRNA_OPTION_MFE - Option flag to specify requirement of Minimum Free Energy (MFE) DP matrices and corresponding set of energy parameters.
VRNA_OPTION_PF - Option flag to specify requirement of Partition Function (PF) DP matrices and corresponding set of Boltzmann factors.
VRNA_OPTION_WINDOW - Option flag to specify requirement of DP matrices for local folding approaches.

detaileddescription.para: The above options may be OR-ed together.

If you just need the folding compound serving as a container for your data, you can simply pass VRNA_OPTION_DEFAULT to the option parameter. This creates a vrna_fold_compound_t without DP matrices, thus saving memory. Subsequent calls of any structure prediction function will then take care of allocating the memory required for the DP matrices. If you only intend to evaluate structures instead of actually predicting them, you may use the VRNA_OPTION_EVAL_ONLY macro. This will seriously speedup the creation of the vrna_fold_compound_t.

simplesect.para: The sequence string must be uppercase, and should contain only RNA (resp. DNA) alphabet depending on what energy parameter set is used

parameterdescription.para: A single sequence, or two concatenated sequences seperated by an '&' character
An optional set of model details
The options for DP matrices memory allocation

simplesect.para: A prefilled vrna_fold_compound_t ready to be used for computations (may be NULL on error)

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a vrna_fold_compound_t data structure for sequence alignments.

detaileddescription.para: This function provides an easy interface to obtain a prefilled vrna_fold_compound_t by passing an alignment of sequences.

The optional parameter md_p can be used to specify the model details for successive computations based on the content of the generated vrna_fold_compound_t. Passing NULL will instruct the function to use default model details. The third parameter options may be used to specify dynamic programming (DP) matrix requirements.

listitem.para: VRNA_OPTION_DEFAULT - Option flag to specify default settings/requirements.
VRNA_OPTION_MFE - Option flag to specify requirement of Minimum Free Energy (MFE) DP matrices and corresponding set of energy parameters.
VRNA_OPTION_PF - Option flag to specify requirement of Partition Function (PF) DP matrices and corresponding set of Boltzmann factors.
VRNA_OPTION_WINDOW - Option flag to specify requirement of DP matrices for local folding approaches.

detaileddescription.para: The above options may be OR-ed together.

If you just need the folding compound serving as a container for your data, you can simply pass VRNA_OPTION_DEFAULT to the option parameter. This creates a vrna_fold_compound_t without DP matrices, thus saving memory. Subsequent calls of any structure prediction function will then take care of allocating the memory required for the DP matrices. If you only intend to evaluate structures instead of actually predicting them, you may use the VRNA_OPTION_EVAL_ONLY macro. This will seriously speedup the creation of the vrna_fold_compound_t.

simplesect.para: The sequence strings must be uppercase, and should contain only RNA (resp. DNA) alphabet including gap characters depending on what energy parameter set is used.
vrna_fold_compound_free(), vrna_fold_compound(), vrna_md_t, VRNA_OPTION_MFE, VRNA_OPTION_PF, VRNA_OPTION_EVAL_ONLY, read_clustal()

parameterdescription.para: An optional set of model details
The options for DP matrices memory allocation

simplesect.para: A prefilled vrna_fold_compound_t ready to be used for computations (may be NULL on error)

briefdescription.para: Free memory occupied by a vrna_fold_compound_t.

parameterdescription.para: The vrna_fold_compound_t that is to be erased from memory

briefdescription.para: Add auxiliary data to the vrna_fold_compound_t.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows one to bind arbitrary data to a vrna_fold_compound_t which may later on be used by one of the callback functions, e.g. vrna_recursion_status_f(). To allow for proper cleanup of the memory occupied by this auxiliary data, the user may also provide a pointer to a cleanup function that free's the corresponding memory. This function will be called automatically when the vrna_fold_compound_t is free'd with vrna_fold_compound_free().

simplesect.para: Before attaching the arbitrary data pointer, this function will call the vrna_auxdata_free_f() on any pre-existing data that is already attached.

parameterdescription.para: The fold_compound the arbitrary data pointer should be associated with
A pointer to an arbitrary data structure
A pointer to function that free's memory occupied by the arbitrary data (May be NULL)

briefdescription.para: Add a recursion status callback to the vrna_fold_compound_t.

detaileddescription.para: Binding a recursion status callback function to a vrna_fold_compound_t allows one to perform arbitrary operations just before, or after an actual recursive computations, e.g. MFE prediction, is performed by the RNAlib. The callback function will be provided with a pointer to its vrna_fold_compound_t, and a status message. Hence, it has complete access to all variables that incluence the recursive computations.

simplesect.para: vrna_recursion_status_f(), vrna_fold_compound_t, VRNA_STATUS_MFE_PRE, VRNA_STATUS_MFE_POST, VRNA_STATUS_PF_PRE, VRNA_STATUS_PF_POST

parameterdescription.para: The fold_compound the callback function should be attached to
The pointer to the recursion status callback function

briefdescription.para: The Basic Fold Compound API.
